New Records: David Willey reached 100 one-day international wickets in his final England appearance before retirement
Chris Woakes broke Ian Botham’s England record for most World Cup wickets
Key Match Events: David Willey took 3 for 56 and reached 100 ODI wickets
Chris Woakes took 1 wicket and broke Ian Botham’s England record
Pre-Game Insights: England opted to bat first despite needing a big score to sneak into the semi-finals
Matthew Mott mentioned that a number of changes were coming to the team
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler played down talk of a “clearout”
Matthew Mott made it sound like a number of changes were coming
David Willey celebrated his 100th ODI wicket with his teammates
Chris Woakes reflected on his World Cup career and the record he broke
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the iconic Eden Gardens in Kolkata
The crowd was a 37,000-strong and was positively itching to start the festive period
The match was a far cry from England’s opening fixture against New Zealand in Ahmedabad
Sachin Tendulkar was holding the trophy on the day that England’s hopes of retaining it suffered a blow
England ended their World Cup campaign on a high note with a 93-run win over Pakistan
Others: Ben Stokes was injured in the gym upon arrival in India and missed the first three matches
England played more warm-up cricket in Asian conditions before the big push, their bowlers might have located their lengths sooner
David Willey announced his retirement from ODIs
Moeen Ali, who claimed two for 60 and left Mohammad Rizwan on his backside, bowled on the charge for 36, is another to signpost the likely end of his personal 50-over road
